## Whale Evolution: A Case History
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Phylogenetic trees based on morphology place whales outside of the artiodactyl group**

<br/>

* **Atiodactyl: mammals - cows, deer and hippos** 
    + hooves, even number of toes, and an unusual pulley-shaped ankle bone

<br/>

* **Astragalus ankle bone is a synapomorphy shared by all artiodactyls**

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:575px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/whale1.jpg">


## Whale Evolution: A Case History
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right ; width: 50%;">

* **How do we determine these relationships?**
    + morphology - presence/absence of weird ankle bone
    + DNA sequences - shared gene families

<br/>

* **Depends on what you have!**
    + poor fossils 

<br/>

* **Sequence data suggests a closer relationship between whales and hippos...**

</div>
